intro: Seseli montanum subsp. peixotoanum, commonly known as the Peixotoan mountain carrot, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, showcasing adaptations to harsh environmental conditions. Its leaves are basal, pinnately lobed, and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and white or pale green. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological niche and potential medicinal properties.
